intro: Juncus elbrusicus, commonly known as the Elbrus rush, is a perennial plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Caucasus Mountains. It is a member of the Juncaceae family and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage composed of narrow, cylindrical leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its ecosystem.
